contentrichtext.text: {{For|the municipality in [[Minas Gerais]]|Itapecerica, Minas Gerais}} {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Coord|23|43|02|S|46|50|58|W|scale:50000|display=title}} '''Itapecerica da Serra''' is a municipality in the state of [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]] in [[Brazil]]. The population in 2006 is 162,239, the density is 1,071.2 inh./km² and the area is 151 km². The name ''Itapecerica'' is believed to come from the [[Tupi language]] for ''slippery stone'', and ''da Serra'' means ''of the Mountains'' in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]. ==History== Itapecerica da Serra was founded in 1562 by the [[Company of Jesus|Jesuit]] missionaries. It was one of several settlements [[Christianity|Christianized]] [[Brazilian indians|indians]], established around the [[Piratninga College]] (later to become the city of [[São Paulo (city)|São Paulo]]) as a first line of defense against raids by hostile Indians. Besides the local inhabitants, the village incorporated natives from the village of [[Carapicuíba]], brought by ''[[bandeirante]]'' [[Afonso Sardinha]] and priest [[Belchior Pontes]]. {{Geographic Location | Centre = Itapecerica da Serra | North = [[Embu]] | Northeast = | East = [[São Paulo]] | Southeast = | South = [[Embu-Guaçu]] and [[São Lourenço da Serra]] | Southwest = | West = [[Cotia]] | Northwest = }} Formerly the language spoken was "manbulês." It was terrible to walk down the street and see everyone screaming "Mabula, Mabula, aimmededom, aimmededom." ==External links== * [http://www.encontraitapecerica.com.br Encontra Itapecerica - Find everything about Itapecerica da Serra] {{São Paulo state|Metropolitana de São Paulo}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Itapecerica Da Serra}} [[Category:Populated places in São Paulo (state)]] {{SaoPauloState-geo-stub}}
